title: 107_hr5661
content: The "College Tuition Assistance Act of 2002" increases the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "College Tuition Assistance Act of 2002" increases the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The dollar limit for taxable years 2002 is $5,000 and $10,000 for 2003 and beyond. A phaseout based on adjusted gross income is also introduced, reducing the allowable deduction under certain conditions. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is subject to a phaseout based on adjusted gross income. Adjusted gross income is calculated without considering specific sections and after applying certain provisions. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is subject to a phaseout based on adjusted gross income. For taxable years beginning after 2002, the $65,000 and $130,000 amounts in paragraph (3)(B)(i)(II) will be adjusted for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. The amendments made by this section apply to payments made in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001. If the amount is not a multiple of $1,000, it will be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $1,000. Expansion of Lifetime Learning Credit. The Lifetime Learning Credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the credit percentage from 20% to 28%. Additionally, there is an increase in the Adjusted Gross Income limits for eligibility. The Lifetime Learning Credit percentage is increased from 20% to 28%, with Adjusted Gross Income limits for eligibility also raised. The amount taken into account for the credit is reduced based on taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income. The reduction in the amount taken into account for the Lifetime Learning Credit is based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, with specific thresholds for single and joint filers. The taxpayer's adjusted gross income for the taxable year is increased by any amount excluded from gross income under specific sections. Conforming amendments are made to certain sections of the tax code regarding income thresholds for tax credits. The amendments made by this section apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2001, including adjustments for certain scholarships and needs-based aid under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The amendments apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2001 for education in academic periods starting after that date. The amendment allows for an expansion of student loan interest deduction on a per-student basis, effective for loan interest paid after December 31, 2001. Additionally, the Pell Grant maximum amounts are extended and increased to $6,500 for the academic year 2003-2004 and $7,000 for the academic year 2004-2005.
